org.drinkless.td.libcore.telegram

Class TG

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.drinkless.td.libcore.telegram.TG

  • public final class TG
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used for managing singleton-instance of class Client.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TG() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Client getClientInstance()
      This function returns singleton object of class Client which can be used for querying TDLib.
      static void setDir(java.lang.String dir)
      Sets directory for storing persistent data of TDLib.
      static void setFileLogEnabled(boolean is_enabled)
      Enables/disables logging to a file in addition to logging to Android Log.

      Sets directory for storing files of TDLib.

      Changes TDLib log verbosity.

      Sets handler which will be invoked for every incoming update from TDLib of type TdApi.Update.
      static void setUseTestDc(boolean use_test_dc)
      Enables/disables logging to a file in addition to logging to Android Log.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • TG

        public TG()

    • Method Detail

      • setUpdatesHandler

        public static void setUpdatesHandler(Client.ResultHandler updatesHandler)
        Sets handler which will be invoked for every incoming update from TDLib of type TdApi.Update. Must be called before getClientInstance().
        Parameters:
        updatesHandler - Handler to be invoked on updates.

      • setDir

        public static void setDir(java.lang.String dir)
        Sets directory for storing persistent data of TDLib. Defaults to the current working directory. Must be called before getClientInstance().
        Parameters:
        dir - Directory to store persistent data.

      • setFilesDir

        public static void setFilesDir(java.lang.String dir)
        Sets directory for storing files of TDLib. Defaults to directory set via setDir(String) Must be called before getClientInstance().
        Parameters:
        dir - Directory to store files.

      • setFileLogEnabled

        public static void setFileLogEnabled(boolean is_enabled)
        Enables/disables logging to a file in addition to logging to Android Log. By default logging to the file is disabled. Must be called before getClientInstance().
        Parameters:
        is_enabled - Directory to store files.

      • setUseTestDc

        public static void setUseTestDc(boolean use_test_dc)
        Enables/disables logging to a file in addition to logging to Android Log. By default logging to the file is disabled. Must be called before getClientInstance().
        Parameters:
        use_test_dc - Directory to store files.

      • stopClient

        public static void stopClient()
        This function stops and destroys the Client. No queries are possible after this call, but completely new instance of a Client with different settings can be obtained through getClientInstance()

      • setLogVerbosity

        public static void setLogVerbosity(int newLogVerbosity)
        Changes TDLib log verbosity.
        Parameters:
        newLogVerbosity - New value of log verbosity. Must be positive. Value 0 corresponds to android.util.Log.ASSERT, value 1 corresponds to android.util.Log.ERROR, value 2 corresponds to android.util.Log.WARNING, value 3 corresponds to android.util.Log.INFO, value 4 corresponds to android.util.Log.DEBUG, value 5 corresponds to android.util.Log.VERBOSE, value greater than 5 can be used to enable even more logging. Default value of the log verbosity is 5.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if newLogVerbosity is negative.

      • getClientInstance

        public static Client getClientInstance()
        This function returns singleton object of class Client which can be used for querying TDLib. setUpdatesHandler(), setDir(), setFilesDir() and setFileLogEnabled() must be called before this function.
